intro: Galium asprellum var. tokyoense, commonly known as Tokyo bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
